channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: In a first, Pakistan Army chief admits its direct role in 1999 Kargil war
item.description: Pakistan army chief General Asim Munir has admitted his military's direct involvement in the 1999 Kargil War against India, ending a long-standing claim that only indigenous Kashmiri rebels fought. He honoured Pakistani soldiers killed in the conflict and acknowledged their sacrifices in previous wars for the country and Islam.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: A street artist documents war in Ukraine, one stark mural at a time
item.description: Ukrainian street artist Gamlet Zinkivskyi joined a volunteer unit to defend Kharkiv but was advised by his commander to paint instead. His murals in bombed-out streets depict wartime realities and boost morale among soldiers and civilians. Despite widespread appreciation, some of his work has faced criticism for its themes.

item.title: Pakistani man charged over alleged plot to attack New York City Jewish centre around October 7
item.description: Pakistani citizen Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, living in Canada, has been arrested for planning an attack on a Jewish center in New York City. Scheduled for October 2024, the attack aimed to kill as many Jewish people as possible in support of the Islamic State. Khan faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted.

item.title: Georgia school shooting suspect was troubled by a broken family, taunting at school, his father said
item.description: Colin Gray and his teenage son Colt are charged with killing two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School. Colt is accused of murder, while Colin faces charges for supplying the weapon. The family struggled after an eviction led to separation a year earlier, affecting Colt's mental state.

item.title: Military cooperation between Tehran and Moscow a threat to Europe, West Asia: Ukraine
item.description: Ukraine's foreign ministry has raised concerns about potential Iranian ballistic missile transfers to Russia, viewing it as a threat to Ukraine, Europe, and the Middle East. The ministry called for increased international pressure on both countries. Reports suggest that Iran has already transferred short-range ballistic missiles to Russia, heightening tensions in the ongoing conflict.

item.title: Hillary Clinton has advice on debating Donald Trump: 'He can be rattled'
item.description: Hillary Clinton, experienced in debating Donald Trump from the 2016 election, provides guidance to Kamala Harris for her debate strategy. Clinton highlights that Trump avoids direct answers and lacks specifics. She advises Harris to expose Trump's leadership flaws by making substantive attacks, which could create voter doubts about his stability.

item.title: In rare move, heads of CIA, MI6 issue joint call for ceasefire in Gaza
item.description: CIA Director William Burns and MI6 Chief Richard Moore have called for a ceasefire in Gaza to de-escalate the Israel-Hamas conflict. They emphasised their intelligence efforts to broker peace and end civilian suffering. The chiefs also discussed global threats from Russia, China, and terrorism while praising Ukraine's resilience against Russian aggression.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Major terror attack foiled, over 30 terrorists arrested in Punjab province of Pakistan
item.description: Law enforcement agencies in Punjab province of Pakistan have arrested 33 terrorists from various banned groups including Al-Qaeda and foiled a significant terror plot. The Counter Terrorism Department conducted 475 intelligence-based operations across different districts, interrogating suspects and recovering weapons and explosives. Cases have been registered against the detained individuals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Super Typhoon Yagi hits Vietnam: At least four killed amid widespread destruction
item.description: Super Typhoon Yagi struck northern Vietnam, leading to at least four deaths and extensive damage. The typhoon uprooted trees, displaced boats, and tore roofs off houses. In anticipation of the devastations, authorities evacuated thousands of residents to safer areas. Before hitting Vietnam, it left a trail of destruction in Southern China and the Philippines.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Olympic rings to stay on Eiffel Tower until 2028: Paris mayor
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mexico arrests alleged drug boss linked to 43 missing students
item.description: A suspected drug cartel boss allegedly linked to the disappearance a decade ago of 43 college students was arrested in Mexico after being released from prison in 2019, authorities said Friday. In September 2014, the 43 students had been traveling to a political demonstration in Mexico City when investigators believe they were kidnapped by the drug cartel in collusion with corrupt police.

item.title: German rail system reports major disruptions due to a technical fault
item.description: Germany's national rail company reported significant disruptions on Saturday due to a technical disturbance affecting the satellite radio communications system. This led to many trains halting at stations, particularly around Frankfurt. The disruption impacted both long-distance and local services, including connections from Frankfurt's airport and main train station. Efforts are ongoing to fix the issue promptly.

item.title: Michael Anthony Guider, convicted pedophile who killed schoolgirl Samantha Knight, dies in custody
item.description: Michael Anthony Guider, a convicted pedophile who murdered nine-year-old Samantha Knight and abused more than a dozen children, died in custody at age 73. Initially sentenced to 17 years, he was released in 2019 but re-arrested in 2022 for violating supervision conditions. Samantha's mother expressed anger over his release.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russian army captures village in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region
item.description: Russian forces have taken control of Kalynove village in Ukraine's Donetsk region, according to the Russian Defence Ministry. This marks a significant advance in their offensive. In another incident, artillery shelling in Kostyantynivka killed three people and injured three others, causing damage to multiple buildings as the frontline approaches.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Ukraine deploys 'dragon drones' that drop molten metal on Russian forces
item.description: Ukraine has introduced 'dragon drones' that deploy thermite against Russian forces. Thermite burns at temperatures up to 4,000 degrees Fahrenheit and can incinerate almost anything. Historically used in both World Wars, this weapon raises issues regarding international humanitarian law due to its destructive capacity and potential for causing extensive environmental damage.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Putin gifts Kim Jong-un 24 horses in exchange for artillery shells used in Ukraine war
item.description: Vladimir Putin has presented North Korean leader Kim Jong-un with 24 purebred Orlov Trotters as partial payment for artillery shells used in Russia’s ongoing conflict in Ukraine. This exchange is part of a continuing diplomatic tradition, highlighting North Korea's substantial investment in thoroughbred horses and their symbolic significance to Kim's regime.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man in California charged with killing 81 animals in a 3-hour shooting spree
item.description: Vicente Arroyo, aged 39, faces charges for killing 81 animals in a three-hour shooting spree in Northern California. He pleaded not guilty to animal cruelty and other offenses. Authorities seized multiple firearms, including illegal weapons. His mental health is under evaluation, and he remains in custody on $1 million bail.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince William's royal plans: No room for Harry and Meghan after becoming king?
item.description: Prince William is strategizing for his future reign by distancing himself from Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. An insider disclosed that William does not foresee a place for the Sussexes within the Royal Family, potentially leading to an irreversible separation. The rift between the brothers remains deep, especially after Harry's memoir, Spare.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'God made me do it': American mom accused of killing 2 of her children fights extradition
item.description: An American woman, Kimberlee Singler, accused of killing her two children in Colorado, claims God made her do it. Singler is fighting extradition to the US, arguing that a life sentence without parole violates European human rights law. The case involves a custody battle and allegations of coerced statements from her surviving daughter.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan: Karachi residents grapple with 12-hour power outages due to illegal electricity sales, infrastructure issues
item.description: Karachi residents endure prolonged power outages and electricity theft, disrupting daily life and schoolwork. Load shedding spans up to 12 hours, causing significant inconvenience. Local individuals allegedly sell electricity illegally with the help of K-Electric employees. Although steps are being taken to address these issues, implementation remains slow.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
